intro: Praravinia celebica, commonly known as the Celebes praravinia, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian archipelago. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and elongated, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
